description:
The current Zones implementation supports the basic functions of get, pause, rescue, etc. (create is part of distributed-scheduler)

What's missing are the OpenStack commands for backup_schedules and consoles (shared-ip-groups are not implemented currently anyway).
title: Zones needs to support ancillary server functions

comments.content:
The current Zones implementation supports the basic functions of get, pause, rescue, etc. (create is part of distributed-scheduler)

What's missing are the OpenStack commands for backup_schedules and consoles (shared-ip-groups are not implemented currently anyway).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sandy-walsh

comments.content: @Sandy: are you currently working on that ? If not we should probably leave it unassigned to let other people have a try at fixing it...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Let's leave it unassigned for now. The framework is in place for supporting them so anyone can grab them.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sandy-walsh

comments.content:
This is the @reroute_compute stuff?

Can you update the list of server actions that are missing it?

Also, note that this will be removed if https://review.openstack.org/3629 is merged
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc

comments.content: https://review.openstack.org/3629 was indeed merged. Since Zones no longer exist, marking as invalid
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fifieldt
